summary: The Coast Guard maintains a network of signs, markers, buoys, and lighthouses to help mariners safely navigate through U.S. waters. The condition of these navigation aids—both fixed (e.g., lighthouses) and floating (e.g., buoys)—has declined in recent years while the overall costs for repairing or replacing them have gone up. The Coast Guard is considering ways to address this situation, such as replacing steel buoys with...
title: Coast Guard: Initiatives to Address Aids to Navigation Challenges Could be Enhanced to Better Ensure Effective Implementation
